source_sentence: 時大臣等於樹陰下，見彼丈夫瓌偉異常人間罕匹，日光雖度樹影不移，眾人共觀咸歎希有：『此善男子妙相端嚴更無過者，樹影留覆固是非凡，可觸令寤。』
translation: When the ministers and others were under the shade of a tree, they saw this man whose appearance was so beautiful and extraordinary that few people could match it, and whose shadow didn't budge even though the sunlight passed over him, and they all looked at him and praised him as rare: 'This good man's marvelous features are so dignified that there's nothing beyond them, and the shadow of the tree that remains is certainly extraordinary; you can touch him and make him wake up.'

source_sentence: 彼既覺已，問諸人曰：『何故相驚？』
translation: After they realized this, they asked the others, 'Why are you so surprised?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『仁合為王故相覺耳。』
translation: He answered, 'The combination of kindness and awakening is the reason we're the king.'

source_sentence: 報曰：『覺王之法豈合如然？』
translation: He replied, 'How could the awakening of the king's teaching be like this?'

source_sentence: 諸人問曰：『其法如何？』
translation: The people asked, 'What's the teaching?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『先奏美音漸令覺悟。』
translation: He replied, 'First, he played a beautiful sound that gradually made him enlightened.'

source_sentence: 群臣聞已作如是念：『此非貧子定出高門。』
translation: After the ministers heard this, they had this thought, 'This isn't a poor man who's surely left the high gate.'

source_sentence: 即共問曰：『仁住何方？
translation: They all asked, 'Where does your servant live?'

source_sentence: 誰家之子？』
translation: Who's the son of?'

source_sentence: 「時彼王子年雖弱冠，壯氣先成如師子王，高聲爽亮自述祖宗，告諸人曰：『我昔先主名曰善生，子號足飲食，我是其兒名多足食。』
translation: "The prince, though young and weak, had the stamina of a lion king who described his ancestry in a loud, clear voice and addressed the people, saying, 'My predecessor's name was Sun Sang, and his son was called Adequate Food and Drink; I'm his son named Adequate Food.'

source_sentence: 時六大臣聞是語已，皆生踊躍咸云：『我等今者還得本王。』
translation: When the six ministers heard those words, they all rejoiced and said, 'Now, we've all regained our original king.'

source_sentence: 盛備威儀廣陳音樂，千軍萬眾從入城中，灌頂稱王化洽黎庶，舊多足食斯名遂隱，由宗重起號曰重興。
translation: They prepared a large display of music with great pomp and ceremony, and a thousand troops and ten thousand people entered the city, consecrated the king, and made him known to the common people.

source_sentence: 「年幼為王，諸臣見慢，所有勅令多不奉行。
translation: "When he was a young king, his ministers looked down on him and didn't obey many of his commands.

source_sentence: 王於暇日出城遊觀，聚落居人並皆存問：『此等是誰所管封邑？』
translation: On his free days, the king wandered around the city, and the townspeople all asked, 'Whose feudal domain is this?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『咸是某甲大臣所有。』
translation: He answered, 'They all belong to a certain minister.'

source_sentence: 便生念曰：『城邑聚落咸屬大臣，我雖是王但有宮闈及食而已，自餘國產並皆無分，有乖國憲將如之何？』
translation: Then he gave rise to the thought, 'All the towns and villages belong to the ministers; even though I'm the king, I only have palaces and food, and I have no part in the rest of the country's property; what would happen if I violated the country's constitution?'

source_sentence: 時有天神知王所念，空中告曰：『王不須憂，於此國中有一都處名曰滿財，城內有人名曰圓滿，當生一子號為大藥，成立之後與王共理，臨機制斷無遠不伏，王極快樂垂拱安神。』
translation: Then a god knew what the king was thinking and told him from the air, 'Don't worry, king, there's a place in this country called Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, and there's a man in that city named Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra who will give birth to a son named Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra and will work with the king after he's established, control his abilities without fail, and make the king extremely happy and calm his spirit.'

source_sentence: 時王令使往滿財城，訪問圓滿，為有？
translation: The king then sent an envoy to the city of Pūrṇa and asked Pūrṇa to visit him, "Does he have a son named Pūrṇa?

source_sentence: 為無？
translation: Why not?

source_sentence: 若其有者，應觀彼妻為有娠不？
translation: If he does, should he examine his wife to see if she's pregnant?

source_sentence: 使者受命即往尋求，見其夫主問婦有娠。
translation: The envoy was ordered to go and seek her out, and he met her husband and asked if she was pregnant.

source_sentence: 使還奏曰：『是事非謬，彼婦懷娠。』
translation: The envoy returned and said, 'This is not a mistake; the woman is pregnant.'

source_sentence: 王既聞已即令使去，召圓滿來善言慰喻，即以此城賜為封邑，告曰：『汝婦有娠好須養護勿令傷損。』
translation: After hearing this, the king sent the messenger away, summoned Pūrṇa to speak kindly and comfortingly to him, then granted him this city as a feudal domain, and told him, 'Your wife is pregnant, so take good care of her and don't let her get hurt.'

source_sentence: 月既滿已便誕一男，形貌端嚴世間無比，三七日後欲為立名。
translation: After the moon was full, she gave birth to a boy whose appearance was exquisite and unsurpassed in the world, and after three or seven days she wanted to name him.

source_sentence: 諸親議曰：『未知此兒欲作何字？』
translation: The relatives said, 'What do you want to call this boy?'

source_sentence: 母便告曰：『我抱宿疹，遍問諸醫，雖進湯藥竟無瘳損；及懷此子病苦即除，宜與孩兒名為大藥。』
translation: The mother then told him, 'I've been holding a late-term rash and have consulted doctors, but even though I was given hot water and medicine, I wasn't healed; now that I've conceived this child, his illness and pain will be gone, so it's better to give him what's called great medicine.'

source_sentence: 母說頌曰：「『於諸患苦中，　　大藥最為勝；　　此是藥中妙，　　可名為大藥。』
translation: The mother spoke a verse, saying, 'Among the afflictions and pains, this is the greatest medicine; this is the best of medicines, and it can be called great medicine.'

source_sentence: 「後時其父肩擎大藥詣池澡浴，於其道上見有魚骨，謂是寶珠蹴之令出。
translation: "Later, his father carried the great medicine on his shoulder and went to bathe in a pool. On the path, he saw a fish bone and asked him to squeeze it for a precious pearl.

source_sentence: 大藥報曰：「『見地有魚骨，　　脚蹴謂真珠；　　自業不肯修，　　強覓他遺寶。
translation: Daya reported, 'He saw a fish bone on the ground and called it a real pearl when he swatted it with his foot; he refused to cultivate his own karma and forced himself to search for another's leftover treasure.

source_sentence: 他所棄魚骨，　　斯非是寶珠；　　豈有毘沙門，　　棄珠於道上？』
translation: That fish bone discarded by another is not a precious pearl; is there a Vaiśravaṇa who discards a pearl on the path?'

source_sentence: 「父將大藥既至池已，置於岸上脫衣入水，見白鶴鳥在荷葉上，便作是念：『我取此鳥。』
translation: "After he reached the pond with the great medicine, his father put his robe on the bank and got into the water. When he saw the white crane bird on a lotus leaf, he thought, 'I'll take this bird.'

source_sentence: 即欲前就鳥遂高飛。
translation: He then wanted to go ahead and get the bird, so he flew away.

source_sentence: 大藥報曰：「『鳥居荷葉上，　　見父已高飛；　　無宜更近前，　　欲取他生命。』
translation: Daya reported, 'The bird was living on a lotus leaf, and it saw its father flying away. It would be inappropriate to approach it again, wanting to take another life.'

source_sentence: 「又於他日肩持大藥，往弶伽河方為洗浴。
translation: "On another day, he took the great medicine on his shoulders and went to the Nāgas River to bathe himself.

source_sentence: 既至河所，置兒岸上，脫衣入河，有大銅鉢隨流東下。
translation: When he arrived at the river, he put his robe on the bank, took off his clothes, and entered the river, where a large copper bowl was flowing eastward with the current.

source_sentence: 時有白鵝蹲踞其上，父見生疑不知何物？
translation: A white goose was crouching on top of it, and when my father saw it, he had doubts about it and didn't know what it was.

source_sentence: 顧問其子，大藥報曰：「『弶伽東注下，　　銅鉢隨流去，　　白鵝居在上，　　斯非是餘物。』
translation: He consulted his son, and Daya reported, "The snare gathers in the east, the copper bowl goes downstream, and the white goose lives on top of it; this is not something else.

source_sentence: 「又於他日同前澡浴，持大藥去置於岸上。
translation: "On another day, he took a bath like the one before, took the great medicine, and placed it on the shore.

source_sentence: 時有澡瓶及草隨流浮去，鳥居其上，大藥同前以頌白父。
translation: A bathing pot and a blade of grass floated away with the current, and a bird sat on top of it while the great medicine went forth in praise of Father Bai.

source_sentence: 是時大藥既漸齠年，與諸童子一處遊戲，眾共議曰：『我等無主，可尊大藥為王。』
translation: As he was growing older, Daya and the boys were playing together, and they all agreed, 'We have no lord; we can honor Daya as king.'

source_sentence: 大藥立已，揀諸童子將為輔佐，從是之後朋黨日多。
translation: After Daya had been established, he chose the boys to be his assistants, and from then on his clique grew large.

source_sentence: 時有老婆羅門娶得少婦，客遊他鄉隨路而去。
translation: Then, a wife married to a young woman traveled to another village and left on a road trip.

source_sentence: 時婆羅門行趣叢薄欲為便利，有一麁人來問女曰：『彼是汝父耶？
translation: When the brāhmaṇa was traveling through a jungle and wanted to make things easier, a debilitated man came to her and asked, 'Is that your father?'

source_sentence: 祖耶？』
translation: grandfather?'

source_sentence: 女曰：『非父非祖乃是我夫。』
translation: The woman said, 'Not my father, not my grandfather, but my husband.'

source_sentence: 麁人報曰：『汝無羞恥不愧友朋，於此世間美妙丈夫遍滿大地，豈可不見？
translation: The vexatious man replied, 'You're shameless and unashamed, friend. How could you not see a wonderful man who fills the whole world?'

source_sentence: 因何逐此老婆羅門？
translation: Why did you banish this wife from the Rāhman?

source_sentence: 汝此容華虛令喪失，宜應棄彼與我為妻。
translation: You have wasted your beauty and lost it, so you should abandon them and take me as your wife.

source_sentence: 若彼老公來諍訟者，於大眾所引我為夫。』
translation: If that old man comes to argue, he'll take me as his husband in public.'

source_sentence: 其女受言，即與麁人隨路而去。
translation: Accepting his words, the woman and the debilitated man went off on their way.

source_sentence: 時婆羅門就池洗已，覓婦不得登高四望，見人將去即便急走，至其婦所捉一手牽。
translation: After washing herself in the pond, the brāhmaṇa looked up high and looked around when she couldn't find the woman, and when she saw her about to leave, she rushed away and grabbed her by the hand.

source_sentence: 時彼麁人亦牽一手，婆羅門曰：『汝偷我婦。』
translation: When the debilitated man also took one hand, the Brāhmaṇa said, 'You stole my wife!'

source_sentence: 麁人曰：『我能設誓：「此是我妻，元非汝歸。」』
translation: The debilitated man said, 'I could have made a vow, 'This is my wife; you didn't get her back.'

source_sentence: 因生鬪諍各相牽引，少年強力女被將去。
translation: A dispute arose, and each pulled the other along, and the young man's strong woman was led away.

source_sentence: 時婆羅門自知無力，冀有相助行於曠野，大叫高聲云：『賊劫婦。』
translation: Knowing himself to be powerless, the Brāhmaṇa wanted some help walking through the wilderness, and he shouted, 'The thief is robbing the woman!'

source_sentence: 是時大藥與諸童子戲野林中，聞彼大叫失婦之聲。
translation: Vairocana and the boys were playing in the wild forest when they heard his voice shouting, 'He's robbed of his wife!'

source_sentence: 時諸童子報大藥曰：『仁既稱王，有斯非理，叫云：「失婦！」
translation: The boys then reported to Daya, 'Since you're called the king, this is unreasonable, shouting, 'Missing the woman!'

source_sentence: 何不相救？』
translation: Why don't you help each other?'

source_sentence: 大藥聞已，即令諸童子執彼三人，問言：『向爭何事？』
translation: After he heard this, Tāhārāya told the boys to take the three of them and asked, 'What was the dispute about?'

source_sentence: 婆羅門曰：『我老無力，被賊劫婦。』
translation: The brāhmaṇa said, 'I'm old and powerless, and the thief took my wife.'

source_sentence: 賊曰：『此人妄語，實是我妻。』
translation: The thief said, 'That person is lying, but she's really my wife.'

source_sentence: 大藥問女：『誰是汝夫？』
translation: Daya asked the woman, 'Who's your husband?'

source_sentence: 彼便指賊：『此是我夫。』
translation: He then pointed to the thief, 'This is my husband.'

source_sentence: 是時大藥見婆羅門椎胸懊惱自撲于地，即便伺察驗彼真虛，問少年曰：『汝於何處將此婦來？』
translation: Seeing the Brāhmaṇa beat his chest and throw himself to the ground in anguish, Daya then examined him to see if he was really there and asked the young man, 'Where did you bring this woman?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『從妻舍來。』
translation: He answered, 'I came from my wife's house.'

source_sentence: 問曰：『有何飲食？』
translation: He asked, 'What do you have to eat and drink?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『肉羹及飯加以清觴。』
translation: He replied, 'Meat and rice are served in a clear and precise manner.'

source_sentence: 大藥曰：『若如是者，我觀其食以辯真虛。』
translation: Daya said, 'If that's the case, I'll examine his food to discern its true emptiness.'

source_sentence: 即令以指抉口，竟無一物空見流涎。
translation: He then told them to pick their mouths with their fingers, but nothing was left empty and drooling.

source_sentence: 問婆羅門曰：『爾從何來？』
translation: He asked the Brāhmaṇa, 'Where did you come from?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『從婦家來。』
translation: He answered, 'I came from a woman's house.'

source_sentence: 『所食何物？』
translation: 'What are you eating?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『酪漿及餅加以蘿菔。』
translation: He answered, 'Cheese curd and bread are added to a lox.'

source_sentence: 告言：『汝可吐出。』
translation: He told them, 'You may spit it out.'

source_sentence: 即便抉出，一如所言。
translation: He then spat it out, just as he had said.

source_sentence: 大藥見已知少是賊，劫彼老妻，即與重杖，掘地為穽，埋之齊咽，以孔雀膽書其額上作如是字：『諸有偷婦賊者准此科罪。』
translation: When the great physician saw that he knew that the young man was a thief who had robbed his old wife, he took a heavy stick, dug up a hole in the ground, buried it close to his throat, and wrote on his forehead with a peacock's gall, 'All thieves who steal from women should be judged by this.'

source_sentence: 如是乃有偷牛羊等，數有五百皆悉同此而為治罰。
translation: Thus, there were 500 thefts of cattle and sheep, and they were all punished in the same way.

source_sentence: 「時重興王現有村城，皆被六臣之所控執，王作是念：『我今力弱將欲如何？』
translation: "When the king of Chungxing now had a village or town that was under the control of six ministers, the king thought, 'What will I do now that my strength is weak?'

source_sentence: 遂憶大藥，思與相見，不告諸臣整軍而出，往滿財城欲看大藥。
translation: He then remembered the great medicine and wanted to meet it. Without telling his ministers, he gathered his troops and left for Pūrṇaśaila to see the great medicine.

source_sentence: 途經險阻聞有大叫，遍觀求覓不見有人，王之左右周旋顧察，見五百賊埋身出頭，即報王知，讀其額字，云：『皆是賊。』
translation: When he passed through a dangerous obstacle and heard a great shout, he looked around and saw no one there. The king looked around and saw five hundred thieves buried in their heads, and he reported it to the king, reading their foreheads and saying, 'All are thieves.'

source_sentence: 王見此事，問言：『誰苦楚汝？』
translation: Seeing this, the king asked, 'Who is afflicting you?'

source_sentence: 諸人答曰：『此是大藥童子准法而作，不罰無辜。』
translation: The people replied, 'This is the Great Medicine Boy's doing according to the teaching, and he's not punished or innocent.'

source_sentence: 王聞稱善，起悲愍心，遂便釋放。
translation: Hearing that they were well behaved, the king became compassionate and released them.

source_sentence: 是時大藥及諸童子，聞王軍至隨處而住。
translation: When he heard that the king's army had arrived, Daya and the boys stayed wherever they were.

source_sentence: 時滿財城所有人眾聞王欲至，悉皆營辦吉祥之物，金瓶持水幢蓋幡旗出城迎候。
translation: When the crowd at Pūrṇaśaila heard that the king was about to arrive, they all brought up auspicious items, gold bottles with water, banners, shrouds, and flags, and went out to meet them.

source_sentence: 王慰問已，問言：『圓滿之子名曰大藥，今可速來。』
translation: After the king greeted them, he asked, 'The son of Pūrṇa is named Daya, now can you come quickly?'

source_sentence: 父白王曰：『童子幼小未堪奉命。』
translation: The father said to the king, 'The boy is too young to be ordered.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『可令前進。』
translation: The king said, 'You may allow him to go forward.'

source_sentence: 父便引見。
translation: The father then showed him to the king.

source_sentence: 王見童子，嘉其容儀雅麗兼有勇略之才，以其尚小不任委寄旦留付父，迴軍都邑。
translation: When the king saw the boy, he praised his elegant appearance and his courageous abilities.

source_sentence: 至本城已，作如是念：『我今可試大藥童子智策才術。』
translation: When he arrived in his native city, he thought, 'Now, I can test the Boy of Medicine's wisdom, strategy, and skill.'

source_sentence: 即令使往語圓滿曰：『汝可以砂挼繩長一百肘，速遣將來。』
translation: He had his envoy go to Yuanquan and tell him, 'You can make a sand rope a hundred elbows long and quickly send it to him.'

source_sentence: 圓滿聞勅極大驚怖，深懷憂惱作如是念：『我自生來未曾聞見如是之事，以砂作繩。』
translation: Hearing his command, Pūrṇa was terrified and became deeply distressed, thinking, 'I've never heard or seen anything like this since I was born, making a rope out of sand.'

source_sentence: 憂惱而住。
translation: He stayed in anguish.

source_sentence: 大藥見父問曰：『父何憂色？』
translation: When Daya saw his father, he asked, 'Father, what's the look of grief?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我未曾聞如是之事，王從我索砂繩百肘，以此方便加罪於我。』
translation: He answered, 'I've never heard of such a thing, but the king asked me for a hundred elbows of sand rope, and this was a way to inflict a sin on me.'

source_sentence: 大藥報曰：『使人何在？
translation: Daya reported, 'Where's the messenger?'

source_sentence: 令我得見傳語奏王。』
translation: Let me see and convey a message to the king.'

source_sentence: 父令使見，大藥報曰：『仁當為我奏大王曰：「仄陋小臣寡聞少見，又無智策仰測天心，未審大王須何色繩？
translation: When my father told the messenger to see him, Daya reported, 'Sir, you will present this message to the king for me, saying, 'My humble servant has little knowledge and views, and I have no wisdom or strategy to discern the mind of the gods.

source_sentence: 王處帝都朝多俊又，請垂一肘以樣示人，非直百肘短繩，千尋亦應可辦。」』
translation: The king is in an imperial capital where there are many handsome people, so he asks them to show him a single elbow, whether it's a short rope with a hundred elbows or a thousand inquiries.'

source_sentence: 使去白王具陳其事，王曰：『此是父說？
translation: The messenger went and told the king exactly what happened. The king said, 'Did your father say this?'

source_sentence: 為子言乎？』
translation: Do you speak for your son?'

source_sentence: 對曰：『是大藥語。』
translation: He replied, 'This is the great medicine that was spoken.'

source_sentence: 王既聞已生希有心，憶彼天神所言是實，當令我國覇王可期。
translation: After hearing this, the king gave rise to a rare thought, remembering that what the gods had said was true and would make our country a great king for years to come.

source_sentence: 「後於異時，王復令使往彼城中，遣其作飯熟可將來，又告曰：『其穀不得臼內舂擣，亦不令一粒米碎，不居室內不在於外，烝煮之時非火非無火，將飯來時不行於道不於非道，不得步涉亦不乘騎，勿令見日復不在陰，擎飯之人非男非女。』
translation: "Some time later, the king again sent an envoy to that city to prepare rice ripe for the future, telling it, 'That grain mustn't be pounded and rewashed in a mortar, and not a grain of rice will be broken; it won't live inside or outside the house; when it's cooked, it won't be on fire or without fire; when it comes in, it won't be on the road or on the wrong road; it won't be walked or ridden; it won't be seen in the sun or in the shadows; and the person carrying the rice will be neither male nor female.'

source_sentence: 使持王命至滿財城，便命圓滿共相慰問，具以王教告彼令知，聞更驚惶憂惱而住。
translation: The messenger took the king's order to Pūrṇa and ordered Pūrṇa to come together to greet him and tell him about the king's teaching, and he was terrified and distressed when he heard it.

source_sentence: 大藥見憂，進白父曰：『何故憂色？』
translation: When he saw how distressed he was, Medicine went in and said to his father, 'What's the reason for the sad look?'

source_sentence: 父遂具告，大藥曰：『此不足憂，我當盡辦。』
translation: His father then told him, and Daya said, 'This isn't enough to worry about; I'll do everything.'

source_sentence: 即取稻穀多集諸人，令一一粒以指撚糠，米無有碎。
translation: He then gathered a large amount of rice and made them twist the chaff with their fingers, one by one, so that none of the rice would crumble.

source_sentence: 既辦得米，便求煮處，即於門外簷下安釜煮之，上赫日光傍以火炙，其飯便熟。
translation: Once he had finished the rice, he then sought a place to cook it, so he put a kettle under the canopy outside his door and cooked it while the sun was shining above and the fire was roasting beside it, and the rice was cooked.

source_sentence: 持飯去時，告使者曰：『汝可一足履道一足踐荒，所持飯器置於頂上，蓋踈布傘、非日非陰；一足著鞋、一足徒跣，此即非步非乘，使用閹人便是非男非女。』
translation: As he was carrying the rice, he told the messenger, 'You may walk with one foot on the path and trample the wilderness with the other, place the vessel for rice on the roof covered with a cloth umbrella, neither sun nor shade, put on shoes with one foot, and barefoot with the other, which means you're not walking or riding, and the eunuch who uses it is neither male nor female.'

source_sentence: 持飯至已進入奉王，王問使者，彼皆具答，王聞大喜：『是誰所為？』
translation: When the messenger asked him about it, he answered everything, and the king was delighted when he heard it, 'Who did this to you?'

source_sentence: 答：『是大藥。』
translation: He answered, 'It's Daya.'

source_sentence: 王極驚嗟，謂使者曰：『大藥謀略深遠，有大智慧善閑法式，觀其計策實為王佐之才。』
translation: The king was extremely surprised and admired him, saying to the messenger, 'Daya has profound plans and great wisdom, and he's skilled in the ways of the Dharma; his plans really are the talents of a king's assistants.'

source_sentence: 「後於異時，復令使去報圓滿曰：『我須園苑，林池具足花果茂盛，可速將來。』
translation: "At another time, he sent another envoy to report to Pūrṇa, saying, 'I need a garden with ample woods and ponds, and flowers and fruits will grow abundantly, so I can come quickly.'

source_sentence: 使至彼已具陳其事，圓滿憂惱：『此事難為，園苑無情不可移轉，欲令持去豈可得乎？』
translation: When the messenger arrived, he explained everything, and Pūrṇa was troubled, 'This is a difficult thing to do; the garden is insentient and irreversible; how could I possibly ask him to leave it?'

source_sentence: 大藥見憂，如前問答，父曰：『寧得不憂？
translation: When Daya saw that he was worried, he answered as before, and his father said, 'How could he not be worried?'

source_sentence: 王索園池，如何將去？』
translation: How will the king take us to the lake?'

source_sentence: 大藥曰：『父不須憂，我皆為辦，令王歡喜。』
translation: Daya said, 'Father, don't worry; I'll do everything to make the king happy.'

source_sentence: 即報使曰：『既奉王命敢不遵行，但為此處園池長自荒野，進止法式皆未諳知，若至都城恐有輕觸。
translation: He then reported to the envoy, 'Since I've been ordered by the king, I dare not disobey his order, but since this garden and pond grow up in the wilderness, I don't know the way in or out, and I'm afraid I might come into contact with the capital if I were to go there.

source_sentence: 伏願大王降一小園，暫來相引隨後而去，此事可成。』
translation: Please pray that the king will send down a small park to us and guide us there for a while, and then we can accomplish this.'

source_sentence: 使還具奏。
translation: The ambassador returned and reported it.

source_sentence: 王曰：『是誰之言？』
translation: The king said, 'Whose words are these?'

source_sentence: 答言：『大藥。』
translation: He replied, 'Great medicine.'

source_sentence: 王倍驚歎實為希有。
translation: The king was doubly amazed and praised it as truly rare.

source_sentence: 「後於異時復令使去，送特牛五百令彼養飼，專供乳酪勿令事闕。
translation: "At some point later, he sent another envoy away with 500 special cattle to feed and to provide milk and cheese, so that they wouldn't run out of things to do.

source_sentence: 使至具報，圓滿憂惶，大藥見父同前問答，父曰：『寧得不憂？
translation: When the messenger arrived, he reported that he was completely distressed, and when Daya saw his father and answered him, he said, 'How could you not be distressed?'

source_sentence: 王遣特牛令供乳酪，既求非所，得之無由。
translation: The king sends a special cow to serve milk and cheese, but since it's not what's wanted, there's no way to get it.

source_sentence: 若不遵王命致招重罰。』
translation: If I don't obey the king's order, I'll incur a heavy punishment.'

source_sentence: 大藥曰：『請父勿憂，我思其計，令王聞已不徵乳酪。』
translation: Yama said, 'Please don't worry, Father; I've thought of a plan to make the king not ask for cheese after hearing about it.'

source_sentence: 即召父子二人具教其事：『汝向王城，伺王出時，相去非遠，以大木盂繫於父腹，上以裙覆宛轉于地啼哭呻吟，汝以香花告諸天眾：「於十方處咸請護持，願令我父產生安隱。」』
translation: He summoned father and son and instructed them in detail, 'Go to the king's city, wait for the king to leave, and when he's not far away, tie a large wooden bowl to your father's belly, cover it with a skirt, turn around on the ground, and weep and moan, and tell the gods with flowers of incense, 'Please protect my father in the ten directions, and may he give birth to a child in peace.'

source_sentence: 既受教已父子相隨，至王都處見王欲出，去之不遠如所教事，次第皆作。
translation: After they had received the teaching, father and son followed each other to the king's capital, where they saw the king about to leave and went not far from there to do as they had been taught, in order.

source_sentence: 子啼出聲告四天王曰：『願降慈悲，得令我父產生安隱。』
translation: The son cried out and told the four celestial kings, 'May it please you to have mercy on my father and give birth to a child in peace.'

source_sentence: 王聞其聲，令使往問：『何故出聲？』
translation: When the king heard his voice, he sent an envoy to ask, 'What's the reason for the voice?'

source_sentence: 使見一人宛轉于地，其腹甚大號叫出聲，子以香花告諸天眾，使人問曰：『汝何所為？』
translation: When the messenger saw a man wandering about on the ground with a huge belly and a shout, the son told the gods with a scented flower that the messenger asked, 'What do you do?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我父欲產不能安隱，為此悲啼請天擁護。』
translation: He answered, 'My father couldn't be at ease when he wanted to give birth, so he asked the gods to protect him because of this lamentation.'

source_sentence: 使迴白王。
translation: The messenger returned to the king.

source_sentence: 王喚父子問：『作何事？』
translation: The king summoned father and son and asked, 'What's the matter?'

source_sentence: 即具報王：『我父欲產不能得出，是以悲啼。』
translation: He reported to the king, 'My father wanted to give birth, but he couldn't get out, so he lamented.'

source_sentence: 王聞笑曰：『我未曾聞丈夫生子。』
translation: The king laughed when he heard that, saying, 'I've never heard of a husband giving birth to a child.'

source_sentence: 其子白曰：『誠如王言，王知丈夫不合產孕，何故付五百特牛，令彼圓滿供於乳酪？
translation: His son said, 'Is it true what the king says, that he knows his husband isn't pregnant, so why did he give 500 special cows to complete the offering of milk and cheese?'

source_sentence: 王頗曾聞特牛生子？
translation: Will the king ever hear of a special cow giving birth to a child?

source_sentence: 既無兒子，乳酪何來？』
translation: If there were no son, where would the cheese come from?'

source_sentence: 王笑言曰：『是誰之計？』
translation: The king laughed and said, 'Whose plan was it?'

source_sentence: 使曰：『皆是大藥。』
translation: The envoy said, 'They're all great medicines.'

source_sentence: 王嗟其智。
translation: The king admired their wisdom.

source_sentence: 「後於異時，王與大臣共相議曰：『大藥多知，少有儔類；更以餘事，試察精神。』
translation: "At another time, the king and his ministers discussed this with each other, saying, 'There are many great medicines that are known, but there are few of their kind; let's examine their spirits in regard to other things.'

source_sentence: 即送一騾令圓滿養護：『勿以繮繫，不置室中，不餧刈草，隨處而放。』
translation: He then sent a mule for Pūrṇa to nurture: 'Don't tie it up with bales, don't put it in a room, don't feed it on grass, and leave it wherever you like.'

source_sentence: 使到彼城，騾付圓滿，具告其事：『汝應善養勿令損失，如不依教當罪汝身。』
translation: When the messenger arrived in that city, he gave the mule to Pūrṇa and told him the following, 'You must nurture it well so that it won't be lost; if you don't follow the teaching, you'll be blamed for your own body.'

source_sentence: 圓滿聞已憂箭射心，作如是念：『此之難事，天無奈何，況當人也！』
translation: After hearing this, Pūrṇa was struck by an arrow of grief and had this thought, 'Such a difficult thing is beyond the power of gods, so why wouldn't it be for humans?'

source_sentence: 大藥見父問答同前，報曰：『父不須憂，我皆為作。』
translation: Seeing his father's question and answer as before, Daya reported, 'Father, don't worry, I'll do it all for you.'

source_sentence: 即於晝日田中放牧、夜收入宅，於逈露處既無繮絆其事難為，專勒二十一人夜中看守，一足之下各配五人，一人乘之更遞掌執終而復始。
translation: He then grazed his animals in the fields by day and took them into his home by night. Since there were no obstacles in the open fields, he had twenty-one men assigned to watch over them at night, five under each foot, and one riding in his hand to carry them to the end and back to the beginning.

source_sentence: 王令人密察如何看守？
translation: The king asked them to closely examine how they guarded the place.

source_sentence: 使報其事，王曰：『若如是者騾無走路，如何加罪？』
translation: When the messenger reported this, the king said, 'If this is the case, the mule doesn't walk; how will it be punished?'

source_sentence: 大臣曰：『可勅乘者，於夜睡時乘騾潛遁，勿使人知。』
translation: The minister said, 'Imazammed the riders to take the mule and hide away while they're asleep at night, so no one will know.'

source_sentence: 彼皆隨作。
translation: They all did as they were told.

source_sentence: 諸防守者至天曉已，報圓滿言：『騾已失矣。』
translation: When the guardians arrived at dawn, they reported to Pūrṇa, saying, 'The mule is gone.'

source_sentence: 既聞告已恐喪形命憂惱燒心。
translation: After hearing this, they feared losing their lives and their minds were burned with grief.

source_sentence: 大藥知已作如是念：『如稍寬縱設計可成，臨急相迫情懷恐懼。』
translation: Knowing this, the great healer had this thought, 'A little leniency would have done the job, but when we're faced with an emergency, we're afraid.'

source_sentence: 告其父曰：『略有一計為之稍難，若父不憚羞慚當希免罪。』
translation: He told his father, 'There's a plan that's a little difficult, but if my father isn't ashamed and conscience, he'll ask to be excused.'

source_sentence: 父曰：『但令免死，餘復何辭？』
translation: His father said, 'If I can be spared death, what else can I say?'

source_sentence: 大藥即便剃父頭髮以為七道。
translation: Even after shaving his father's hair, Daehak shaved it in seven different ways.

source_sentence: 仍以青黃赤白彩色塗身，令乘一驢往至都邑，唱大音聲云：『大藥今至并將父來，剪飾形儀誠是奇異。』
translation: He then painted his body with blue, yellow, red, and white colors, rode it to the capital on a donkey, and called out a loud voice, saying, 'Now, Daya has arrived and brought his father here, and his trimmed appearance is truly marvelous.'

source_sentence: 時王大臣聞斯說已共作是語：『大藥遠來此為善事，然辱其父有點憲章。』
translation: When the king's ministers heard this, they all said, 'This is a good deed for Daya to come all this way, but it's a shame that his father has some sort of constitution.'

source_sentence: 王及諸人皆出城外共迎大藥，觀其所作為實？
translation: The king and his men went outside the city to meet him and see if what he had done was true.

source_sentence: 為虛？
translation: Why is it empty?

source_sentence: 王及城人觀知是實，于時大臣遂白王曰：『如何大王先作是語：「大藥聰慧智策過人。」
translation: When the king and the people of the city observed this to be true, the minister then said to the king, 'How did the king first say, 'This is a clever, wise plan for great medicine that's beyond human understanding?'

source_sentence: 觀此所為一何鄙賤！』
translation: What a despicable thing to observe!'

source_sentence: 王問大藥曰：『何故汝今令父毀辱以至於此？』
translation: The king asked Daya, 'Why have you now caused your father to be so disgraced as to do this?'

source_sentence: 答言：『大王！
translation: He replied, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 今以為榮不知其辱。
translation: 'Now, I take pride in this and don't know its shame.

source_sentence: 臣有眾多善巧智慧，今以此事供養於父。』
translation: I have so much skillful wisdom, and now I'm offering this to my father.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『汝智與父，孰為優劣？』
translation: The king said, 'Which is superior, your wisdom or your father's?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我勝。』
translation: He answered, 'I'm better.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『我不曾聞子勝於父。
translation: The king said, 'I've never heard that a son is superior to his father.

source_sentence: 子從父生養育勞倦，以此而言父勝於子。』
translation: A son is born from his father and travails in nurturing him, so that's why the father is superior to the son.'

source_sentence: 大藥曰：『惟王審察父子誰賢？』
translation: Daya said, 'May I ask the king to examine which of the father and son is superior?'

source_sentence: 王與大臣俱言：『父勝。』
translation: The king and his ministers both said, 'The father is superior.'

source_sentence: 大藥前進稽首白言：『大王前令養騾遂便逃失，此驢乃是騾父，理勝於兒，願王招領勿為重責。』
translation: Dayak went forward and bowed his head, saying, 'The king had previously ordered the mule to be raised, and it was lost; this ass is the father of the mule, and it's right that it's better than the son.

source_sentence: 王及大臣聞是語已，嗟奇計智絕代希有。
translation: When the king and his ministers heard these words, they praised their amazing plan as wisdom unmatched in generations.

source_sentence: 王極歡喜遂即廣施盛禮拜為大臣，所有國事皆委裁決，聲譽日聞，庶事明察，遠近委信，莫不歌戴。
translation: Extremely pleased, the king then paid extensive and respectful homage to the ministers, entrusted them with rulings on all affairs of state, and his reputation grew as he became increasingly renowned, his affairs were well observed, and he was trusted by people from far and near, who praised him.

source_sentence: 「時有婆羅門早閑書論，為娶妻故多用財賄，未久之間作如是念：『我為娶妻多有所費，令我宅內財物空虛，獨守貧居豈能存濟？』
translation: "It was then that a Brāhmaṇa who had spent much time in writing and had used a lot of money and bribes to get married before long thought, 'I've spent a lot of money to get married, which has left my house empty of possessions; how could I survive living alone in poverty?'

source_sentence: 遂向他處自衒己技求覓珍財，得五百金錢持以還舍。
translation: They then went elsewhere to show off their skills and seek valuable possessions, and they found five hundred coins to return to their house.

source_sentence: 既至村側作如是念：『我婦少年顏容美麗，與之離別已歷多時，室無男子任情所作，寧知彼意可委信不？
translation: When he arrived at the side of the village, he thought, 'My young woman has a beautiful face, and it's been a long time since I parted with her; there's no man in the house to do as he pleases.

source_sentence: 我此金錢不宜持入。』
translation: This money of mine is not fit to be carried into the house.'

source_sentence: 於曛黃後遂往空林，多根樹下穿地埋舉便之故宅。
translation: After sunset and yellow, he went to his old house in an empty forest and buried himself under a tree with many roots.

source_sentence: 其妻先與外人私通名曰善聽，於此夜中盛設芳饌食已同居。
translation: His wife, who had first had an illicit affair with a man named Good Listening, prepared a delicious meal for him and stayed with him during the night.

source_sentence: 時婆羅門既至宅所扣門而喚，妻遙問曰：『汝是何人？』
translation: When the Brāhmaṇa arrived at the house, he buttoned the door and called out to her, and his wife asked him from a distance, 'Who are you?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我是某甲。』
translation: She replied, 'I'm a certain person.'

source_sentence: 婦聞其名遂藏善聽於臥床下，即去開門詐現喜相，引之令入共至房中，為設餘饌令其飽滿，食已便念：『豈非此婦與外私通？
translation: When the woman heard his name, she hid him under her bed, opened the door, deceivingly showed her a happy face, led him into her room, and filled him up with other foods.

source_sentence: 因何夜中有斯美食？』
translation: Why is there such a delicacy in the middle of the night?'

source_sentence: 其夫性直，問言：『賢首！
translation: His husband, who was straightforward, asked, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 今非好日復無節會，因何得有此上食耶？』
translation: Now, if it weren't for the good days and the lack of festivals, how could there be such an excellent meal?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『近於夢中有天告我：「汝夫欲至。」
translation: He answered, 'Recently, a god told me in a dream, 'Your husband wants to come.'

source_sentence: 為此我知作食相待。』
translation: For this reason, I know I'll make myself available for food.'

source_sentence: 夫曰：『我誠有福，方欲至舍天遂告知。』
translation: The husband said, 'I'm really lucky, for I was about to go to the gods and they told me.'

source_sentence: 食已同寢各問安不？
translation: After we eat and sleep together, will each ask, 'Is it okay?'

source_sentence: 婦曰：『君離我去年月已深，求覓財錢有所得不？』
translation: The woman said, 'You've been away from me for a long time; can you find some money?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『薄有所得。』
translation: She replied, 'I've only gotten something.'

source_sentence: 婦遂陰言，意告床下，云：『我善聽須知其數。』
translation: The woman then spoke quietly, motioning down to the bed, saying, 'I've listened well and need to know how much it is.'

source_sentence: 問曰：『得幾許來？』
translation: She asked, 'How much has been gained?'

source_sentence: 答：『得五百金錢。』
translation: He answered, 'I got five hundred coins.'

source_sentence: 婦曰：『安在何處而不告我？』
translation: The woman said, 'Where was it that you didn't tell me?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『且自安隱，明日將來。』
translation: He replied, 'Take care, for tomorrow will come.'

source_sentence: 婦曰：『我與君身事同一體，何須隱避而不告知？』
translation: The woman said, 'We're in the same physical situation, so why should we hide and not tell him?'

source_sentence: 彼性愚直，答曰：『安在城外。』
translation: Being foolish and straightforward, he answered, 'It's outside the city.'

source_sentence: 云：『我善聽須知處所。』
translation: They said, 'I'm a good listener and need to know where it is.'

source_sentence: 問：『在何處？』
translation: He asked, 'Where is it?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『在某林中多根樹下。』
translation: He answered, 'He's in a certain forest under many trees with roots.'

source_sentence: 婦曰：『聖子行路辛苦且當安寢。』
translation: The woman said, 'The noble son has traveled far and hard, so he should sleep soundly.'

source_sentence: 知其睡已作如是語：『善聽聞者可速為之。』
translation: After she knew he was asleep, she said this, 'Good, listen, and do it quickly.'

source_sentence: 即從床出向多根樹下，取得金錢持還本宅。
translation: He then got out of his bed and went to the bottom of the tree of many faculties, took the money, and returned to his original home.

source_sentence: 其婆羅門既至天曉，往藏錢處唯見空坑一無所覩，即自拍頭椎胸大哭還向宅中。
translation: When it was daybreak, the Brāhmaṇa went to the place where he had hidden the money and saw only an empty pit and nothing to look at, so he beat his head and beat his chest, crying out, and returned to his house.

source_sentence: 諸有親屬及餘知識，共來問曰：『何故憂悲？』
translation: Some of his relatives and other friends came together and asked, 'Why are you so sad?'
